bill_title: to establish degrees of unlawful occupancy and prescribe penalties therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish degrees of unlawful occupancy and prescribe penalties therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-35-5 be amended to read as follows: 22-35-5. Any person who, knowing that he the person is not privileged to do so, enters or surreptitiously remains in any unoccupied building or structure, is guilty of unlawful occupancy in the second degree. Unlawful occupancy in the second degree is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Any person who, knowing that the person is not privileged to do so, enters or surreptitiously remains in any occupied building or structure, is guilty of unlawful occupancy in the first degree. Unlawful occupancy in the first degree is a Class 6 felony. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to establish degrees of unlawful occupancy and prescribe penalties therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-35-5 be amended to read as follows: 22-35-5. Any person who, knowing that he the person is not privileged to do so, enters or surreptitiously remains in any unoccupied building or structure, is guilty of unlawful occupancy in the second degree. Unlawful occupancy in the second degree is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Any person who, knowing that the person is not privileged to do so, enters or surreptitiously remains in any building or structure, where another person is present, is guilty of unlawful occupancy in the first degree. Unlawful occupancy in the first degree is a Class 6 felony. BILL HISTORY 1/23/97 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 140 1/31/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/31/97 Judiciary Do Pass, AYES 6, NAYS 1. S.J. 274 2/4/97 Deferred to another day. S.J. 310 2/5/97 Senate Do Pass Amended, AYES 33, NAYS 2.
